segments.text: I really can't believe what I'm seeing in this kitchen right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This woman is just standing there, polishing a plate as if nothing is amiss.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet is wide open, and the sink is overflowing like a waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is just pouring over the cabinet doors and onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She has one foot squarely in the growing puddle, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is utterly blank, focused solely on that ceramic dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's in her own little world, oblivious to the rising tide around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can anyone be so utterly detached from their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me a bit frustrated to see such a clear and present danger go unnoticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's going to cause some serious water damage if she doesn't stop it soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The steady flow of water just keeps coming, relentlessly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are also quite a sight, adding to the silent chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her serene focus on a clean plate feels almost comical in this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just reach in and turn off that faucet for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels like a snapshot of domestic blindness.
segments.speaker: PAR
